streetPID.title: Street Information Displays
streetPID.goalsDescription: The objective of this project was to meet the requirements set by public tenders, which demanded the implementation of real-time bus arrival screens in public information displays. These screens are installed at bus stops or transit centers, providing passengers with information about upcoming bus arrivals and other relevant information without any user interaction. Additionally, the application was designed for private transport companies, such as those offering transport services from the Barcelona cruise terminal to the city center, ensuring that passengers are informed in real-time.
streetPID.clientList: Transports Urbans de Sabadell, Govern d’Andorra, Aena Barcelona, Aena Madrid.
streetPID.figmaPhotoshop: Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator for prototyping and UI design.
streetPID.itsApi: Intelligent Transport System (ITS) web manager for real-time bus data (JSON or XML format).
streetPID.weatherApi: Optional integrations with open-source weather APIs and the AENA API to display flight information for specific clients.
streetPID.architectureDescription: The application manages real-time data by integrating with multiple APIs, supplying bus arrival schedules, weather conditions, or flight information, depending on client configuration. Key data points include:
streetPID.dataPointsBusArrival: Bus arrival times (including UI elements like colors and multimedia content).
streetPID.dataPointsOptional: Optional weather or flight information based on specific client requests.
streetPID.continuousFunction: The system is designed to run continuously, updating the public information display at preset intervals.
streetPID.realTimeDescription: Automatically fetches bus arrival schedules, colors, and media for visualization. Content updates based on timers, with no user interaction.
streetPID.customDescription: Depending on the client, the application can also display weather and flight data.
streetPID.accessibilityDescription: Integration of text-to-speech (TTS) for visually impaired passengers, activated by the 'Ciberpass' system, which also controls traffic lights.
streetPID.hardwareDescription: The application needed to run on different screens with variable sizes, aspect ratios, and Android versions. Compatibility was ensured through flexible designs and thorough testing.
streetPID.nonInteractiveDescription: Since users cannot interact with the screen, timers were used to automate updates and manage background processes efficiently.
streetPID.accessibilitySolution: The integration of TTS with GPIO and 'Ciberpass' provides audio announcements for visually impaired passengers.
streetPID.designDescription: The design was created using Figma, Photoshop, and Illustrator, with a focus on clarity and ease of use for public display.
streetPID.interactionDescription: Since users cannot interact with the screen, timers were carefully chosen.
streetPID.layoutDescription: The design was optimized for large screens, ensuring readability from a distance while integrating accessibility features like TTS for visually impaired passengers.

OnBoardPID.title: Onboard Information Display
OnBoardPID.description: This onboard display app provides real-time information for passengers inside buses, including upcoming stops, destinations, connections to other public transport, and media content such as videos or images. For buses heading to airports, the app also displays upcoming flight information. The app can also handle audio announcements to improve accessibility for passengers.
OnBoardPID.myRoleDescription: Designer and frontend developer, specializing in UX.
OnBoardPID.projectImageAlt: Image of the onboard display project
OnBoardPID.apisDescription: Real-time bus data for stops and routes, AENA API for flight information, and media content integrations
OnBoardPID.dataManagementDescription: The app is designed to manage multiple data streams efficiently with automatic updates.
OnBoardPID.busDataDescription: Fetched from the company’s database, populated by its intelligent transport system content manager.
OnBoardPID.connectionsInfoDescription: Comes from both the AMB API and the company's own database for real-time transport connections.
OnBoardPID.autoUpdateDescription: T Ensures the app stays updated to the latest version, including any system updates or new features.
OnBoardPID.dataHandlingDescription: The app uses asynchronous updates to manage real-time information, ensuring smooth operation with temporary caching in case of network issues.
OnBoardPID.stopInformationDescription: Displays upcoming bus stops, final destinations, and connections to other public transport systems.
OnBoardPID.airportIntegrationDescription: For buses heading to the airport, the app displays upcoming flight information using the AENA API..
OnBoardPID.mediaContentDescription: Supports various types of media (videos, images) for informational or advertising purposes.
OnBoardPID.audioAnnouncementsDescription: The app provides audio announcements for upcoming stops and other important updates, improving accessibility for all passengers.
OnBoardPID.realTimeDataDescription: Ensuring accurate synchronization of bus stop data, flight information, and media content required efficient API management and background updates.
OnBoardPID.hardwareCompatibilityDescription: The app needed to run smoothly across different display systems inside buses, requiring flexible design and thorough testing.
OnBoardPID.accessibilityDescription: The integration of audio announcements ensured the app was accessible for visually impaired passengers.
OnBoardPID.uiDesignDescription: The UI is designed to be clear and visible to all passengers, with timely updates on bus stops, routes, and other travel information. The app is optimized to manage multiple types of content, from transport updates to media, without overwhelming system resources.
OnBoardPID.videoDescription: This video showcases the real-time information system onboard an Aerobus, which connects central Barcelona with the airport. The flow begins with the bus departing from a stop, displaying connections. Next, all stops along the route are shown, with completed stops grayed out. The screen then splits to display the current time, followed by flight connections. Informative images and videos are presented while continuously displaying the upcoming stop, ensuring passengers stay informed throughout the journey.

otherApps.title: Other Apps
otherApps.projectDescription: Here, you'll find a collection of smaller projects, primarily focused on passenger transportation and mobility solutions. Each project is designed to improve the efficiency, convenience, and experience for both passengers and operators. These solutions are also developed to meet the specific requirements of public tenders, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.

campapp.title: Campapp
campapp.goalDescription: The app enables drivers to view their assigned vehicle, its location, and their scheduled shifts for the day. It was required to be bilingual, supporting both English and Māori, and optimized for the T2 mini device.
campapp.roleDescription: I designed the app with UX principles in mind and developed the frontend using Android Studio.

ticketingApp.title: Ticketing app
ticketingApp.goalDescription: The app allows bus drivers to validate tickets, check ticket validity, and sell tickets using either cash or credit card. It was developed to run on two devices: Sunmi T2 Mini and Sunmi P2 Pro.
ticketingApp.roleDescription: Designing components and user flows, applying both UX and UI principles.

driverDevice.title: Driver device
driverDevice.goalDescription: The app assists drivers by showing whether they are adhering to the schedule, displaying upcoming trips, passenger count, the next stop, and their location on a map. It was required to fit specific device constraints.
driverDevice.roleDescription: Redesigned the app to fit various devices and customized the UI for different clients.

teletext.title: Teletext
teletext.projectDescription: This is a multidisciplinary project where we reflect on the social and expressive changes brought by the transition from an analog world to an increasingly virtual one. Inspired by the 'hybrid imagination' of the millennial generation, we wanted to revive a communication format from our childhood—teletext, a hybrid bridge between analog and digital. Using an online real teletext coding tool, we explore, with irony, how products, services, and forms of expression are becoming obsolete in a world increasingly shaped by AI.
